simple.monitor

Interface Progressable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ProgressableThread
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ProgressableThreadImpl

    public interface Progressable
    Interface for anything that can use a progress bar.
    Created: Jun 26, 2006
    Author:
    Kenneth Pierce

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getCurrentValue()
      Returns the current value.
      String getError()
      Returns a String containing an error message if one occured.
      int getMaximum()
      Returns the number that needs to be reached in order to finish.
      String getMessage()
      Returns a message about the current operation.
      int getMinimum()
      Returns the number to start at.
      JProgressBar getProgressBar()
      Return the progress bar that this object is using.
      boolean isAborted()
      Returns whether the operation was aborted.
      Should return true if the operation was canceled because of an error.
      boolean isCanceled()
      Returns whether this operation was canceled.
      This should return true if the user canceled the operation.
      boolean isDone()
      Returns whether this operation is finished.
      void setProgressBar(JProgressBar pbar)
      Sets the progress bar that this object will use.

    • Method Detail

      • setProgressBar

        void setProgressBar(JProgressBar pbar)
        Sets the progress bar that this object will use.
        Parameters:
        pbar -

      • getProgressBar

        JProgressBar getProgressBar()
        Return the progress bar that this object is using. If none was set prior to its calling a default will be made.
        Returns:
        The progress bar associated with this progressable

      • getMaximum

        int getMaximum()
        Returns the number that needs to be reached in order to finish. This number can change over time.
        Returns:
        The maximum number for this object.

      • getMinimum

        int getMinimum()
        Returns the number to start at. This number may change over time, though it generally shouldn't.
        Returns:
        The starting number for this object.

      • getCurrentValue

        int getCurrentValue()
        Returns the current value. This should not be below the minimum or above the maximum.
        Returns:
        The current number for this object.

      • getMessage

        String getMessage()
        Returns a message about the current operation. This may change over time.
        Returns:
        A message about the current operation.

      • isDone

        boolean isDone()
        Returns whether this operation is finished.
        Returns:
        True if the operation is finished.

      • isCanceled

        boolean isCanceled()
        Returns whether this operation was canceled.
        This should return true if the user canceled the operation.
        Returns:
        True if the operation was canceled.

      • isAborted

        boolean isAborted()
        Returns whether the operation was aborted.
        Should return true if the operation was canceled because of an error.
        Returns:
        True if the operation was aborted.

      • getError

        String getError()
        Returns a String containing an error message if one occured. I.e. isAborted() or isCanceled() returns true.
        Returns:
        An error message if an error occured. If none occured then it should return an empty String.
